sn3.2:1.2: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha,
sn3.2:1.3: “Sir, how many things arise inside a person for their harm, suffering, and discomfort?”
sn3.2:2.1: “Great king, three things arise inside a person for their harm, suffering, and discomfort.
sn3.2:2.6: These three things arise inside a person for their harm, suffering, and discomfort.”
sn3.2:2.7: That is what the Buddha said. …
sn3.2:3.3: they harm a person of wicked heart,
sn3.2:3.4: as a reed is destroyed by its own fruit.”
